titleStmt.title: Verses made on Molly Mog, the Innkeeper

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Says my Uncle I Pray you discover, What has been the cause of yrÌ£ Woes,
That you Pine & you whine like a Lover?I've seen Molly Mog of the Rose.2
Oh! Nephew! your Grief is but Folly, In town you may find better Prog,
Half a crown there will gett you a Molly,A Molly much better than Mog.3.
The Schoolboys delight in a Play-Day The School-Master's Ioy is to Flog
Fop, is the Delight of a Lady,But mine is in Sweet Molly Mog.4.
Will a Wisp leads the Traveller a gadding, Thro' Ditch, thro' Quagmire & Bog,
No light can e'er sett me a Padding,But the Eyes of my Sweet Molly Mog.5.
For Guineas in Other Men's Breeches, Your Gamesters will Palm & will Cog
But I envy them none of their Riches,So I Palm, my Sweet Molly Mog.6.
The Hart that's half wounded in ranging, It here & there, leaps like a Frog,
But my Heart, can never be changingI'ts so fix'd on my Sweet Molly Mog.7.
I know that by Wit's tis recited, That Women, att best are a Clog,
But I'm not so easily frighted,From Loving my Sweet Molly Mog.8.
A Letter when I am inditing Comes Cupid & gives me a Jog
And I fill all my Paper with writingOf nothing but sweet Molly Mof.9.
I feel I'm in love to Distraction, My Sences are lost in a Fog,
And in nothing can find Satisfaction,But in thoughts of my sweet Molly Mog.10.
If I woud not give up the Grace's I wish I were hang'd like a Dog,
And att Court all the Drawing-Room Faces,For a Glance of my Sweet Molly Mog.11.
For those Faces, want Nature and Spiritt, And seem as cut out of a Log,
Iuno, Venus, and Pallas's MerittUnite in my Sweet Molly Mog.12.
Were Virgil Alive with his Phillis, And writing another Eclogue,
Both his Phillis & fair Amarillis,He'd give for my Sweet Molly Mog.13.
When Molly comes up with the Liquor, Then Iealousy sets me a Gog,
To be Sure, she's a Bit for the VicarAnd so I shall lose Molly Mog.
